meanings.definition: A raised platform with a desk used for lecturing or conducting business.
meanings.sent1: The teacher stood behind the almemar to address the class.
meanings.sent2: The CEO stood on the almemar to deliver an important presentation.
meanings.sent3: The comedian pretended to trip over the almemar during the show.
meanings.sent4: The almemar in the conference room symbolized authority and leadership.
meanings.sent5: The shiny almemar in the auditorium caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: To speak or address from a pulpit or lectern.
meanings.sent1: The pastor will almemar his sermon during the church service.
meanings.sent2: She almemared her speech confidently in front of the audience.
meanings.sent3: The politician almemared his promises to the voters.
meanings.sent4: Her words almemared through the crowded hall, capturing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The coach almemared instructions to the team before the game.
